name: jevt.obj
description: Alias for json.obj, provided for backwards compatibility.

name: jevt.rawtime
description: Alias for json.rawtime, provided for backwards compatibility.

name: jevt.value
description: Alias for json.value, provided for backwards compatibility.

name: json.obj
description: The full json message as a text string.

name: json.rawtime
description: The time of the event, identical to evt.rawtime.

name: json.value
description: Extracts a value from a JSON-encoded input. Syntax is json.value[<json pointer>], where <json pointer> is a json pointer (see https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6901)

name: ka.auditid
description: The unique id of the audit event

name: ka.auth.decision
description: The authorization decision

name: ka.auth.openshift.decision
description: The authentication decision of the openshfit apiserver extention. Only available on openshift clusters

name: ka.auth.openshift.username
description: The user name performing the openshift authentication operation. Only available on openshift clusters

name: ka.auth.reason
description: The authorization reason

name: ka.cluster.name
description: The name of the k8s cluster

name: ka.impuser.name
description: The impersonated user name

name: ka.req.binding.role
description: When the request object refers to a cluster role binding, the role being linked by the binding

name: ka.req.binding.subject.has_name
description: Deprecated, always returns \

name: ka.req.binding.subjects
description: When the request object refers to a cluster role binding, the subject (e.g. account/users) being linked by the binding

name: ka.req.binding.subjects.group_names
description: When the request object refers to a cluster role binding, the subject group names being linked by the binding

name: ka.req.binding.subjects.serviceaccount_names
description: When the request object refers to a cluster role binding, the subject service account names being linked by the binding

name: ka.req.binding.subjects.serviceaccount_ns_names
description: When the request object refers to a cluster role binding, the subject serviceaccount namespaced names being linked by the binding, e.g. a list containing: mynamespace:myserviceaccount

name: ka.req.binding.subjects.user_names
description: When the request object refers to a cluster role binding, the subject user names being linked by the binding

name: ka.req.configmap.name
description: If the request object refers to a configmap, the configmap name

name: ka.req.configmap.obj
description: If the request object refers to a configmap, the entire configmap object

name: ka.req.container.host_network
description: Deprecated alias for ka.req.pod.host_network

name: ka.req.container.image
description: Deprecated by ka.req.pod.containers.image. Returns the image of the first container only

name: ka.req.container.image.repository
description: Deprecated by ka.req.pod.containers.image.repository. Returns the repository of the first container only

name: ka.req.container.privileged
description: Deprecated by ka.req.pod.containers.privileged. Returns true if any container has privileged=true

name: ka.req.pod.containers.add_capabilities
description: When the request object refers to a pod, all capabilities to add when running the container.

name: ka.req.pod.containers.allow_privilege_escalation
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the value of the allowPrivilegeEscalation flag for all containers

name: ka.req.pod.containers.args
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the container's args.

name: ka.req.pod.containers.command
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the container's command.

name: ka.req.pod.containers.eff_run_as_group
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the initial gid that will be used for all containers. This combines information from both the pod and container security contexts and uses 0 if no gid is specified

name: ka.req.pod.containers.eff_run_as_user
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the initial uid that will be used for all containers. This combines information from both the pod and container security contexts and uses 0 if no uid is specified

name: ka.req.pod.containers.host_port
description: When the request object refers to a pod, all container's hostPort values.

name: ka.req.pod.containers.image
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the container's images.

name: ka.req.pod.containers.image.repository
description: The same as req.container.image, but only the repository part (e.g. falcosecurity/falco).

name: ka.req.pod.containers.name
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the container's names.

name: ka.req.pod.containers.privileged
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the value of the privileged flag for all containers.

name: ka.req.pod.containers.proc_mount
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the procMount types for all containers

name: ka.req.pod.containers.read_only_fs
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the value of the readOnlyRootFilesystem flag for all containers

name: ka.req.pod.containers.run_as_group
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the runAsGroup gid for all containers

name: ka.req.pod.containers.run_as_user
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the runAsUser uid for all containers

name: ka.req.pod.fs_group
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the fsGroup gid specified by the security context.

name: ka.req.pod.host_ipc
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the value of the hostIPC flag.

name: ka.req.pod.host_network
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the value of the hostNetwork flag.

name: ka.req.pod.host_pid
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the value of the hostPID flag.

name: ka.req.pod.run_as_group
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the runAsGroup gid specified in the security context for the pod. See ....containers.run_as_group for the runAsGroup for individual containers

name: ka.req.pod.run_as_user
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the runAsUser uid specified in the security context for the pod. See ....containers.run_as_user for the runAsUser for individual containers

name: ka.req.pod.supplemental_groups
description: When the request object refers to a pod, the supplementalGroup gids specified by the security context.

name: ka.req.pod.volumes.flexvolume_driver
description: When the request object refers to a pod, all flexvolume drivers specified for all volumes

name: ka.req.pod.volumes.hostpath
description: When the request object refers to a pod, all hostPath paths specified for all volumes

name: ka.req.pod.volumes.volume_type
description: When the request object refers to a pod, all volume types for all volumes

name: ka.req.role.rules
description: When the request object refers to a role/cluster role, the rules associated with the role

name: ka.req.role.rules.apiGroups
description: When the request object refers to a role/cluster role, the api groups associated with the role's rules

name: ka.req.role.rules.nonResourceURLs
description: When the request object refers to a role/cluster role, the non resource urls associated with the role's rules

name: ka.req.role.rules.resources
description: When the request object refers to a role/cluster role, the resources associated with the role's rules

name: ka.req.role.rules.verbs
description: When the request object refers to a role/cluster role, the verbs associated with the role's rules

name: ka.req.service.ports
description: When the request object refers to a service, the service's ports

name: ka.req.service.type
description: When the request object refers to a service, the service type

name: ka.req.volume.hostpath
description: Deprecated by ka.req.pod.volumes.hostpath. Return true if the provided (host) path prefix is used by any volume

name: ka.resp.name
description: The response object name

name: ka.response.code
description: The response code

name: ka.response.reason
description: The response reason (usually present only for failures)

name: ka.security.pod.violations
description: The violation reason for pod security policy

name: ka.sourceips
description: The IP addresses of the client who made the request to the apiserver

name: ka.stage
description: Stage of the request (e.g. RequestReceived, ResponseComplete, etc.)

name: ka.target.name
description: The target object name

name: ka.target.namespace
description: The target object namespace

name: ka.target.pod.name
description: The target pod name

name: ka.target.resource
description: The target object resource

name: ka.target.subresource
description: The target object subresource

name: ka.uri
description: The request URI as sent from client to server

name: ka.uri.param
description: The value of a given query parameter in the uri (e.g. when uri=/foo?key=val, ka.uri.param[key] is val).

name: ka.user.groups
description: The groups to which the user belongs

name: ka.user.name
description: The user name performing the request

name: ka.useragent
description: The useragent of the client who made the request to the apiserver

name: ka.validations.admission.policy.failure
description: The validation failure reason from a Validation Admission Policy

name: ka.verb
description: The action being performed
